positive.review:
I know it wont show on my steam profile but I‚Äôve been playing My Hero Ultra Rumble on my Xbox since it dropped in 2023, and after getting all the way up to the highest rank, I figured I wanna share my thoughts. I‚Äôve watched My Hero Academia since the first season, so I jumped into this game mostly because I love the series but honestly, I ended up staying because the gameplay‚Äôs actually really fun once you get into it. When the game first came out, it was kind of a mess. Balance was all over the place, All Might and Todoroki were way too op and matches could feel super random. But over time, the devs have done a good job tightening things up. Most characters feel usable now, Except the new all for one youth age that recently came out since hes very overpowered right now lol. Getting to the top rank was a grind, though. Solo queueing can be rough since teamwork is such a big deal here. But when you get a good squad, it feels amazing. The ranked climb actually rewards skill and coordination, which I didn‚Äôt expect at first.

 If you‚Äôre a My Hero fan or not, give it a fair shot and stick with it for a bit. Once you get the hang of the quirks and team play, it‚Äôs a blast. Not flawless, but definitely one of the better anime games out there.

8.5/10 ‚ù§Ô∏è
Yes i love ts game it makes me smile when blue deku violently assaults me and ruins my day

A fun, fast-paced battle royal where you and your teammates duke it out as heroes (or villains) from the anime. The combat leans into flashy ‚ÄúQuirk‚Äù abilities, and the team-based gameplay can lead to satisfying coordinated takedowns. The anime aesthetic and character variety give real charm for fans, and being free-to-play lowers the barrier for new players
Genuinely a really fun battle royale, a little hard to get into, but once the ball is rolling, its one of the most entertaining ones out there
Super fun. There is no other way to say that, it is very fun,

This game should not be as enjoyable as it is- the Gacha system compared to others makes Genshin seem generous. A vast majority of the roster are asset rips from My Hero Ones Justice 2 and I wouldn't be surprised if they take assets from the newest MHA game that'll come out. This game has literally so much wrong with it yet it's genuinely so fun and addicting, I only worry for its future since MHA Manga has already ended & MHA anime is about to end alongside the absolute best characters (imo) peaking with the newest Deku, AFO, All Might & Shigaraki. I'm expecting a huge decline in player account once this season is over UNLESS they start adding movie characters and MHA Vigilante characters, then it might have a longer lifespan, and it'd be even longer if MHA continues to get movies which increases hype, increases playercount & increases the amount of characters that can be in the game. 

I recommend this game right now during this season, but once it ends, I can't forsee MHA Ultra Rumble ever peaking like this again or really being worth your time unless the mentioned favorable scenario happens- which is very much possible.

I'm a big fan of MHA although I only got this recently because of a friend! The game is very addicting BUT a few characters are very overpowered. For example All For One (Youth) and Armoured All Might! It's hard to escape them due to their kit. Like All Might just pulls you in with this move that you literally can't get out of and it does a lot of damage. With All For One it's different, you can escape them but before the attack happens, although All For One's attacks cover a lot of land.

Anyway, I find the gacha alright (I play a few gacha games so I'm used to gachas) although I wish it had a pity system (I don't know if it does, I'm still new!), if it does have a pity system, I think it could be better.

I love everything else even though playing matches can be frustrating at times. 

7.5/10

Really fun if you are in to MHA. Pity is too high even for a gacha game (I play a lot of gacha). Character releases are spread out and rewards are fine. Co-op is good but the map/gameplay options are quite limited.
Has a Cheater problem but outside of that I think it's a really great game. It doesn't try to squeeze you for money and is super F2P friendly.

Yes there will be OP characters. Yes your favorite character is most likely behind a gambling paywall. Yes, it will hurt your experience of playing this game. Yes it's completely fine to not play this game because of these conditions.

However, speaking in terms of pure gameplay, you can get away with enough skill and understanding of a character. As someone who played this game as a game, it's not TOO bad.

It's completely free, it's easy to play. If you have 2 friends it's even better. The graphics are good, the game play is WAY better than I expected for a free game like this, there's actual voice acting from the actors (or at the very least very good impersonators). It's definitely a gatcha game but unranked matches are completely unlimited so you don't really need to worry about an energy system. If you're not good at the game or on a lose streak the games don't take very long and you can leave once your team is out without penalty. Honestly this game couldn't be much better except having a bit more variety in maps.

This is an extremely fun game. First off you don't need to watch or read My Hero Academia to understand or play the game (for the most part) as most abilities are self-explanatory or you can easily read what they do, althought I would imagine you'd have a lot more fun if you did.
Starting out without a big event is most likely a pretty bad experience because to get characters you need to roll on a gacha and the pull currency that the battle pass + events/missions give out is just enough to be considered "fine". I'll also state that the pity system in this game sucks complete ass, you'll either HAVE to save up for a banner or get lucky if you really want a character/costume. Also while there may be some p2w aspects you can technically play the game against paying players and win, although you will have a tougher time depending on some circumstances.

Gameplay wise the game is amazing, so many characters with different playstyles and unique abilities since it's tied to an already existing anime IP. The game is also pretty buggy and clunky although most of the bugs are pretty minor. Balancing is a huge issue tho, new characters are usually extremely strong on release and the devs tend to let a lot of characters go under the radar but nothing so big that the game is unwinnable. Some bugs can also either enhance or ruin a character's combo which can leave make you happy or mad depending on who you pick as your main.

There are still some smaller annoyances but the game is definitely worth giving a shot, especially since it's somewhat f2p friendly (kinda, sorta, don't quote me on that).
Underneath the layers of corporate greed and a bit of leaving the game as a side project exists the only battle royal that I can say I had fun playing, the community of this game is pretty friendly and deserves to be treated with more respect by the devs.
Thank you for reading.

This game is so much fun with every match being quite unique. My only complaint is the gatcha system is so overpriced, so you really have to grind the game to get any new character unlocks. Also all skillsets are only unlocked via rolls (gatcha system).. so it makes it really frustrating for new players.

Overall though I love this game, but it does not have any real player-base.. so even with crossplay on I typically run into the same people especially at higher ranked lobbies.

MY HERO ULTRA RUMBLE is a free-to-play 24-player battle royale where you drop in as My Hero Academia characters and immediately remember that **friendship is powerful, but being 3v1‚Äôd is more powerful.**

You pick a hero or villain, form a 3-man squad, and then:

* Land,
* Loot,
* Get one-combo‚Äôd by Bakugo from across the map while All Might body-slams you from orbit.

---

### Pros:

* Actually fun team roles:

  * **Strike** ‚Äì punches first, thinks never
  * **Assault** ‚Äì ranged spam merchant
  * **Rapid** ‚Äì movement gremlin
  * **Technical** ‚Äì ‚ÄúI swear I‚Äôm helping‚Äù support
  * **Support** ‚Äì heals, revives, gets blamed anyway
* Abilities feel ripped straight out of the anime, including:

  * ‚ÄúDelete building‚Äù
  * ‚ÄúStunlock that guy forever‚Äù
  * ‚ÄúMiss everything and pretend it was zoning‚Äù
* You can revive teammates by **hugging their trading card**, which is both adorable and deeply cursed.
* Voice lines and ult animations go unnecessarily hard for a game where half the lobby is looting dumpsters.

---

### Cons:

* Solo queue experience:

  * Teammate 1 lands 300m away
  * Teammate 2 pushes 3 squads alone
  * You‚Äôre in the middle with 2 Common cards and a dream
* You will die in 0.4 seconds to a combo you absolutely could not see under all the particle effects.
* Ranked is just casual, but everyone‚Äôs angrier and somehow only picks DPS.
* Map sometimes feels less like a city and more like a collection of places to get jumped from above.

---

### Peak ULTRA RUMBLE Moments:

* Dropping in with drip, immediately slipping on gravel and getting Detroit Smashed into the stratosphere.
* Watching two squads brawl it out, waiting like a vulture, then third-partying all 6 of them and pretending it was ‚Äúgood rotations.‚Äù
* Being the only Support on the team, healing everyone, and then getting abandoned the moment you get downed.
* Hitting your ultimate, whiffing it completely, still getting a double kill from collateral damage and acting like it was 100% calculated.

---

9/10
It‚Äôs chaotic anime dodgeball with superpowers and trust issues.
Would yell ‚ÄúPLUS ULTRA‚Äù while getting deleted by a level 2 Deku with better timing again.

I LOVE MHA, and for a mha fan this game is awesome!!!!  i love the combat and how you are able to play as your favorite characters!!! especially toga and tomura :3 it's really fun and i am always excited to play!!! though, i will say i really don't like the gacha and the roll's system. it feels rigged and it's hard to get characters or battle styles that you want. For example, I really wanted Assault Shigaraki when he came out, but I never got him even after spending a lot of money to try and roll him. So that kind of annoys me, but besides that this game is amazing!!!! Actually, another thing I dislike is that I find myself getting teamed up with bots and playing with bots most of the time, but when a major update like a new season starting happens there's real players again. I think that's normal with certain games, so it's not that big of an issue. I really wish I had someone to play this game with, I recommend it totally!!!!!! :33

One of the worst game I've played in my WHOLE life. The gameplay is good and all but the problem comes to the matchmaking and the harshness of the matches when your'e new. I couldn't enjoy the game or the mechanics of the characters because I only lasted 38 SECONDS IN THE MATCH.

The gacha mechanic isn't even good. Spend 100 tickets with a percentage of earning them from 10 to 10 IS WILD. Then, you'll have the opportunity to win A SUIT!! NOT EVEN A CHARACTER THAT IS LOCKED FOR YOU TO PLAY ONLY WITH A FEW CHARS!!!

I love the series and it's one of my favourites but this game just makes me want to hate it LIKE I WAS NOT SUPPOSED TO!!!

Whenever I check post death reports its people with maxed out tuning. Most unbalanced game I have ever played. Each character has a cheese method that makes this game psychically impossible to enjoy, no matter how hard I try. Each new character is overpowered, and never gets nerfed. Armored Allmight alone can do a driveby on you and take at least 3/4 of your health while doing it. There's not even the chance to fight back, you just have to accept your fate. This game is only fun *sometimes*. The worst part by far is the fact that it takes 20 hours at least to even give you a character good enough to compete in the average game. This game is a awful disaster that could've been fixed with more attention from the developers. A single patch nerfing some of the more unfair characters would make this game super duper fun.

Lowkey fun game, but once you get the char you want and max em out there's not really anything else to work towards. Played F2P for 2 days, ended up with young afo, his 3 star skin, and a fully tuned loadout just by doing quests. Pretty much everyone I know was able to get whatever they were going for within a day or so, gameplay gets boring quick though and aim assist is so aggressive it may as well be aimbot. Balancing is equally questionable as often at full hp / gp you'll get insta-downed by a team pulling up and using AOE abilities or IFrames. Most notable of which is Kendo (major issue). And the game doesn't really have a way to prevent people keeping you alive when it's 3 on 1 final circle for toxicity or wtv which can drag out the game (since if you leave, you don't get your rewards). Overall, fire concept, mid gacha game in practice.

I am not that far in but so far i have found that the balancing sucks, and with the gotcha aspect it makes the game slightly pay to win as you can just buy a bunch of rolls for the better characters. I think it was really good idea, just a very bad execution

Might be the worst BR game available. 2/3 of the roster is just the first 1/3 copied and pasted then altered ever so slightly, there is a gotcha system that allows for pay to win by pulling special abilities and/or characters, the gameplay itself has not changed at all since the beta/release of the game (clunky, slow and overall just feels bad to play). This game is just another cash grab from a dev that only makes shitty cash grab gotcha games.... Could have had a real game but no.
